newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine Oct unemployment rate drops to 7.4 pct.
newsitem.headline: Philippine Oct unemployment rate drops to 7.4 pct.

text.p: The Philippines' unemployment rate in October 1996 dropped to 7.4 percent compared to 8.4 percent in the same period last year, the government's National Statistics Office (NSO) said.
The country's underemployment rate in October also slipped to 10.7 percent from the year-ago 19.8 percent, the NSO said.
The state agency said in a statement the total number of unemployed persons slipped to 2.2 million from 2.3 million in October 1995.
The NSO said its October 1996 labour force survey indicated a national employment rate of 92.6 percent from 91.6 percent in the same period last year.
It said the country's labour force climbed to 29.637 million from 28.040 million in October 1995.
The number of employed persons was estimated at 27.4 million, up from the previous 25.7 million.

Employment increased to 11.5 million from 11.3 million in the agriculture sector, to 4.6 million from 4.0 million in the industry sector and to 11.4 million from 10.3 million in the services sector, the NSO said.
